CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 28, 1960, pg. A16, reads: "Fashions for Ghana - were shown at the Lambda Kappa Mu Sorority's sorority fashion tea, held recently at the Press Club. Among those who took part were, left to right: Earsley Kincaid, commentator; Maria Jeanne of the House of Originals; Gloria Jean Sweeney and Vera Sidberry, models.  Soror Gladys Robinson, chairman of the affair, gave the history of Ghana during the afternoon.  Proceeds from the affair will go to the national project of the sorority, a mobile unit for Ghana. - Harris Photo."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 4, 1960, pg. 11 reads: "Home-A-Rama Fashions - Milliners Gloria Darcel and Belinda Blandburg (standing left to right) will be displaying their latest creations at The Courier - WAMO Home -A- Rama fashion show.  Show models Gloria Sweeney and Velma Reid are receiving a pre-show fitting.  This is a Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Earsley Kincaid, Maria Jeanne, Gloria Jean Sweeney, and Vera Sidberry modeling in Lambda Kappa Mu fashion show, Press Club
